nodes.title: Article 3
nodes.summary: This partial document outlines the mission and specific responsibilities of an organization (L'UGP-BND) tasked with assisting the Minister of Finance in establishing a National Development Bank for the Democratic Republic of Congo. It details a list of nine key duties, including examining modalities for specialized banks, preparing program documents, conducting and validating feasibility studies, creating a roadmap, engaging with stakeholders, preparing reports, drafting governmental notes, and examining related issues. The text also introduces a new section about the organization's structure and operations.

nodes.title: Article 4
nodes.summary: The partial document outlines the role and responsibilities of the Coordinator for the work of the UGP at BND. It specifies that the Coordinator is appointed by the Minister of Finance, presides over the UGP's activities, convenes meetings, directs debates, and ensures its proper functioning. The Coordinator can establish working groups, reports progress to the Minister of Finance, and is assisted by the Minister's Cabinet Director and Deputy Cabinet Director in carrying out these duties.

nodes.title: Article 5
nodes.summary: The partial document describes the composition, appointment, and operational scope of a unit called "l’UGP-BND." It specifies that the unit is led by a coordinator and includes experts from the Ministry of Finance (four advisors for banking, financial, economic, and legal matters) and the Central Bank of Congo (three delegates). It states that members are appointed and can be removed by the Minister of Finance. Additionally, it notes that the unit can, with the Minister's approval, invite members from other institutions or external experts to assist in fulfilling its financial sector mission.

nodes.title: Article 93
nodes.summary: This partial document is a preamble to a governmental decree or order (ARRETE). It cites the legal foundations, including specific ordinances regarding government structure and ministerial responsibilities, and references the government's action program. It outlines the rationale for the decree, emphasizing the need to strengthen governance, technical capacities, efficiency in development programs, and increase medium-to-long-term financing for major projects. The document is transitioning from these considerations to the general provisions (GENERALES) of the decree itself.
